description: A medium-sized macaw, mostly green with a bright red patch on its forehead and crown, red ear patches, and red on the bend of the wings. Critically endangered.
temperament: Playful, energetic, and curious. They are known for being very social and less aggressive than larger macaws, but they still require plenty of interaction.
loudness: Loud. They have a typical macaw screech, though not as powerful as the largest species.
vocalization: Can learn to mimic words and phrases and can be quite vocal. They have a range of different calls and squawks.
dietaryNeeds: A varied diet is key. A base of pellets should be supplemented with fresh vegetables, fruits, and a small amount of nuts.
healthPointers: Can live for 40+ years. Being critically endangered, they are rare in captivity. They need a spacious environment and plenty of toys to prevent boredom-related behaviors like feather plucking.
housing: Requires a large cage or aviary, at least 36"W x 24"D x 48"H. Their noise level makes them a challenge for apartment living.
